intro: Leucanthea, commonly known as the white heath, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Leucanthea has evergreen foliage composed of glossy, dark green leaves. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
